blocks.text: The Yaesu FT-710 is a compact HF/50 MHz SDR transceiver with 100W output, featuring a 4.3-inch TFT touch screen, 3DSS spectrum display, and AESS (Acoustic Enhancement Speaker System) for high-fidelity audio reproduction.

The SDR receiver uses twin A/D converters with FPGA digital synthesis and dithering technology to improve blocking, IM characteristics, and overall receiver performance. Direct sampling superheterodyne architecture provides excellent receive quality.
The [FUNC] knob provides quick access to settings. Press to display the function screen, rotate to select items, and press again to confirm. Touch screen operation is also available throughout.
The VMI (VFO Mode Indicator) LEDs on both sides of the MAIN dial show VFO-A, VFO-B, Memory mode, and clarifier/split status. Colors can be customized (blue/green/red/white) for each operating state.

The 3DSS (3 Dimensions Spectrum Stream) display shows frequency on X-axis, signal intensity on Y-axis, and time on Z-axis with color-coded signal strength, providing intuitive band condition recognition.
AESS combines the internal top speaker with an optional external side speaker (SP-40) to create high-quality audio with wide frequency range and three-dimensional effect.
Access settings by pressing the [FUNC] knob. Navigate using touch or the knob. Example path: Select [DISPLAY SETTING] > [DISPLAY] > [LED DIMMER].

blocks.name: LED DIMMER
blocks.description: Adjusts the brightness of LED indicators. Found in DISPLAY SETTING > DISPLAY.

blocks.name: CONTRAST
blocks.description: Adjusts display contrast. Found in DISPLAY SETTING > DISPLAY.

blocks.name: Screen Saver
blocks.description: Sets timeout for screen saver activation. Found in DISPLAY SETTING.

blocks.name: My Call Sign
blocks.description: Stores your callsign for display on screen.

blocks.name: VMI Color
blocks.description: Sets the VFO Mode Indicator colors. Select from blue, green, red, or white for each operating state.

blocks.name: AESS Settings
blocks.description: Adjusts output balance and frequency characteristics between internal and external speakers for optimal audio.

blocks.text: Frequently used functions can be assigned to the [FUNC] knob for quick access by simply turning the knob.

Connect a paddle or straight key to the KEY jack on the rear panel. The built-in electronic keyer supports iambic and straight key operation. CW Spotting (zero-beating) helps accurately tune to received signals.

blocks.name: Keyer Speed
blocks.description: Adjusts electronic keyer speed in WPM.

blocks.name: Keyer Weight
blocks.description: Sets the dot/dash ratio for personalized timing.

blocks.name: Keyer Polarity
blocks.description: Reverses dot and dash paddles if needed.

blocks.name: Keyer Mode
blocks.description: Selects operating mode: Straight, Bug, Iambic A, or Iambic B.

blocks.name: CW Delay Time
blocks.description: Sets break-in delay time for semi break-in operation.

blocks.name: Sidetone Level
blocks.description: Adjusts CW sidetone audio level.

blocks.text: Contest Memory Keyer stores CW messages. TEXT Memory allows storing and programming messages by character. Contest Number feature supports automatic serial number increment.

The Filter Function Display in the upper display area shows passband status graphically. You can see the operating status of WIDTH, SHIFT, NOTCH, and CONTOUR at a glance along with the RF spectrum in the passband.

blocks.name: SHIFT
blocks.description: Moves the IF passband to eliminate interference on one side. Use DSP interference removal functions via STEP/MCH button.

blocks.name: WIDTH
blocks.description: Narrows the bandwidth symmetrically to extract weak signals from interfering signals and pile-ups.

blocks.name: NOTCH
blocks.description: Eliminates narrow heterodyne interference from the passband using IF NOTCH filter.

blocks.name: CONTOUR
blocks.description: Provides gentle DSP passband shaping. Adjustable GAIN and bandwidth (Q). Very effective for making weak signals rise above interference.

blocks.name: APF (Audio Peak Filter)
blocks.description: CW audio peaking filter that narrows audio passband around the CW pitch frequency.

blocks.name: DNR (Digital Noise Reduction)
blocks.description: 15-step adjustable noise reduction with algorithm optimization for different noise types.

blocks.name: DNF (Digital Notch Filter)
blocks.description: Automatic tracking filter that attenuates multiple interfering beat signals, even when frequencies change.

blocks.name: NB (Noise Blanker)
blocks.description: Reduces pulse-type noise. Adjustable level and attenuation. Can also reduce longer duration pulse noise.

blocks.name: IPO
blocks.description: Intercept Point Optimization maximizes dynamic range and reduces impact of strong broadcast stations, especially on low bands.

blocks.name: DSP RESET
blocks.description: Resets all DSP interference removal settings to default.

blocks.text: The FT-710 operates from 13.8V DC (+/-15%) with negative ground. It is designed for base station or mobile operation with appropriate power supply.
Do not use voltages other than the specified power supply voltage. Observe correct polarity. Never cut off the fuse holder from the power cable.
The FT-710 includes a built-in automatic antenna tuner. Press the TUNE button to activate. The tuner matches impedances from 16.7-150 ohms on HF (1.8-29.7 MHz) and 25-100 ohms on 50 MHz.
The optional FC-40 external antenna tuner can match wire antennas on 160 through 6 meters. The ATAS-120A active-tuning antenna system is also supported for mobile operation.
The tuner settings are stored for quick recall when returning to previously tuned frequencies. Listen before tuning to avoid interfering with stations already in QSO.

blocks.name: Reset microprocessor
blocks.description: Reset options available in menu to restore factory defaults if experiencing unusual behavior.

blocks.name: SD card issues
blocks.description: Format SD card using the radio's format function. Used for audio recording, settings backup, screen capture, and firmware updates.

blocks.name: AESS audio quality
blocks.description: Connect optional SP-40 external speaker for full AESS effect. Adjust output balance and frequency characteristics to preference.

blocks.name: LAN remote operation
blocks.description: Connect optional SCU-LAN10 LAN unit for remote operation. Configure network settings in menu.

blocks.name: External display
blocks.description: Use EXT-DISPLAY connector for external monitor connection. Set up in display settings.

blocks.name: QMB not working
blocks.description: Quick Memory Bank stores/recalls frequencies. Configure number of QMB channels in settings.

blocks.name: VOX issues
blocks.description: Adjust VOX GAIN, Delay Time, and anti-trip sensitivity for proper voice-activated operation.

blocks.name: Clock and date
blocks.description: Set clock and date in menu. Used for timestamps on recordings and logs.
